item.title: Elegant Turkey Liver Mousse with Cranberry GelÃ©e
item.description: Indulge in the rich and creamy texture of our Elegant Turkey Liver Mousse paired with a vibrant cranberry gelÃ©e. This delightful dish is perfect for family gatherings, offering a beautiful presentation and a comforting flavor that everyone will love.
item.dc:creator: author_003
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 15 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 30 minutes

â° Total Time: 45 minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 4

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Medium

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 1 pound turkey liver, cleaned and trimmed
  • 1 small onion, finely chopped
  • 2 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened
  • 1/4 cup heavy cream
  • 1 tablespoon brandy (optional)
  • Salt and black pepper to taste
  • 2 cups fresh or frozen cranberries
  • 1/2 cup sugar
  • 1 cup water
  • 1/2 teaspoon gelatin powder (dissolved in 2 tablespoons warm water)

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. In a skillet over medium heat, melt the unsalted butter. SautÃ© the chopped onion until it's translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the cleaned turkey liver and cook until browned and cooked through, around 8-10 minutes.
  2. Transfer the cooked liver to a food processor. Add the heavy cream, brandy (if using), and season with salt and black pepper. Blend until smooth and creamy.
  3. Spoon the mousse into serving dishes or ramekins and cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for at least 3 hours, or until set.
  4. In a saucepan, combine the cranberries, sugar, and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer, stirring occasionally until the cranberries burst, about 10 minutes. Let it cool slightly before adding the dissolved gelatin.
  5. Once the gelÃ©e is at room temperature, pour it over the set mousse in the ramekins. Return to the fridge for another hour to firm up.
